text: Could you elaborate about the const global variable in Nemo/Hecke  <@UH24GRBLL>. There is a problem with serialization and precompilation. See <https://github.com/Nemocas/Nemo.jl/issues/810> and related issues. If you need big constant variables, just put them in `__init__`

elements.text: Could you elaborate about the const global variable in Nemo/Hecke
. There is a problem with serialization and precompilation. See
and related issues. If you need big constant variables, just put them in
__init__

text: This is not a Nemo/Hecke problem, but a problem with C backed memory and objects which contain pointers. They are by default non-precompilable, so julia will produce nice and obscure segfaults for you :slightly_smiling_face:

elements.text: This is not a Nemo/Hecke problem, but a problem with C backed memory and objects which contain pointers. They are by default non-precompilable, so julia will produce nice and obscure segfaults for you

text: regular BigInt are also C backed due to GMP, but they're not as fickle as those provided by Nemo/Hecke, so I'm unsure whether it's "just" a problem of C backed memory or not

serialize/deserialze
for BigInt/BigFloat

Yes I have, that's why I'm saying that BigInt works fine.

elements.text: Yes I have, that's why I'm saying that BigInt works fine.

text: Julia tries to serialize the global constants when precompiling. But this yields garbage if the objects are backed by pointers because the fallback serialize function cannot handle this (and will never be able to do it).

elements.text: Julia tries to serialize the global constants when precompiling. But this yields garbage if the objects are backed by pointers because the fallback serialize function cannot handle this (and will never be able to do it).
